original_title: CIPM and University of Kelaniya MOU to collectively develop HR profession
original_body_lines: CIPM Sri Lanka – the Nation’s leader in human resource management, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding recently with the University of Kelaniya to collectively develop the human resource profession for the benefit of HR professionals, the managerial community, and HR students in the country. The signing ceremony was held at the Senate House of the University of Kelaniya.

“We are honoured to collaborate with the University of Kelaniya, which is considered a center of learning in Sri Lanka, to develop the human resource profession in the country collectively. Our collaboration will help raise the bar for the HR fraternity in Sri Lanka, creating value for all HR professionals, companies, and organizations,” said U.A.C. Obeyesekere, CEO of CIPM Sri Lanka.

CEO – U.A.C Obeysekere, Director of Professional and Academics Affairs – G. Weerathunga, Head of Business School – Anushka Earskin,  Head of Finance – Ms. Wathasla Naddeeshani, and Executive  Media & Digital Marketing – K. Thiruchelvam represented CIPM Sri Lanka while Vice-Chancellor of the University of Kelaniya – Senior Professor Nilanthi de Silva, Registrar – K. K. K. Dharmathilka, Dean Faculty of Commerce and Management Studies – Dr P. N. D Fernando, Head and Senior Lecturer Department of Commerce and Financial Management – M. M. M. Shamil and academic staff of the Faculty of Commerce and Management Studies represented the University of Kelaniya at the ceremony.
